diff_hunk:
@@ -119,7 +118,7 @@ class Conv1d(_ConvNd):
          In other words, for an input of size :math:`(N, C_{in}, L_{in})`, if you want a
          depthwise convolution with a depthwise multiplier `K`,
          then you use the constructor arguments
-         :math:`(\text{in_channels}=C_{in}, \text{out_channels}=C_{in} * K, ..., \text{groups}=C_{in})`
+         :math:`(in\_channels=C_{in}, out\_channels=C_{in} * K, ..., groups=C_{in})`
body: I'd vote for keeping the `\text`. My rule of thumb is that if the variable has more than one letter, then it should ideally not be on italic
body_html: I'd vote for keeping the \text. My rule of thumb is that if the variable has more than one letter, then it should ideally not be on italic
body_text: I'd vote for keeping the \text. My rule of thumb is that if the variable has more than one letter, then it should ideally not be on italic
